story_title: Wildlife Strikes on Aircraft: Patterns and Impacts
story_subtitle: Analyzing Wildlife Strikes Across Airports, Aircraft, and Flight Phases

story_pieces.narration: The vast majority of wildlife strikes (85.7%) result in no damage to the aircraft, while a small fraction (10.7%) cause minor damage, and (3.6%) cause medium damage.
story_pieces.question: What is the distribution of damage levels caused by wildlife strikes?

story_pieces.narration: Most wildlife strikes occur during approach (53.6%) and climb (21.4%) phases of flight, with fewer incidents during take-off run (14.3%) and descent (7.1%).
story_pieces.question: During which phases of flight do wildlife strikes most commonly occur?
story_pieces.visualization: bar chart (flight phases vs. strike counts)

story_pieces.narration: Small wildlife (41.1%) and medium-sized wildlife (51.8%) are the most common sizes involved in strikes, with large wildlife accounting for 7.1%. Unknown medium birds account for 39.3% of all strikes.
story_pieces.question: What sizes and species of wildlife are most frequently involved in strikes?
story_pieces.visualization: stacked bar chart (wildlife size vs. species counts)

story_pieces.narration: George Bush Intercontinental Airport (5 strikes), Memphis International Airport (5 strikes), and Washington Dulles International Airport (4 strikes) report the highest number of wildlife strikes among the dataset.
story_pieces.question: Which airports experience the highest frequency of wildlife strikes?
story_pieces.visualization: horizontal bar chart (airports vs. strike counts)

story_pieces.narration: Delta Air Lines (10 strikes), Southwest Airlines (7 strikes), and American Airlines (6 strikes) aircraft are most commonly involved in wildlife strikes, with B-757-200 (6 strikes) and B-737-300 (5 strikes) being the most frequent models.
story_pieces.question: Which airlines and aircraft models are most frequently involved in wildlife strikes?
story_pieces.visualization: grouped bar chart (airlines vs. aircraft models)

story_pieces.narration: Wildlife strikes predominantly occur during daylight (53.6%), with fewer incidents at night (35.7%) and minimal occurrences at dawn/dusk (10.7%).
story_pieces.question: How does the time of day affect the frequency of wildlife strikes?
story_pieces.visualization: pie chart (time of day vs. strike counts)

story_pieces.narration: Texas (10 strikes), DC (5 strikes), and Tennessee (5 strikes) have the highest incidence of wildlife strikes among US states, accounting for 35.7% of all incidents.
story_pieces.question: Which states have the highest frequency of wildlife strikes?
